description: EulerPhi is iterated with initial value n!; a(n) = number of iterations required to reach the fixed state=1.
comments: Powers of 2 arise at the end of iterations without interruption. Analogous to A053025 and A053034. The order of speed of convergence is as follows: A000005>A000010>A051593: e.g. for 20! the lengths of corresponding iteration chains are:6, 51 or 101 resp.
formula: a(n) is the smallest so that Nest[EulerPhi, n!, a(n)]=1
example: for n=1, no iteration is needed; for n=2,initial=2!, then Phi has to be applied once; for n=8, the iteration chain is:{40320,9216,3072,1024,512,256,128,64,32,16,8,4,2,1}, its length=14=a(n)+1 and the number of iterations applied to get 1 is a(8)=13
author: _Labos Elemer_, Feb 25 2000
